about.name: Merlion
about.description: The Merlion is the national personification of Singapore
about.content: Its name combines 'mer' meaning the sea and 'lion'. The fish body represents Singapore origin as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which means 'sea town' in Javanese. The lion head represents Singapore's original name-Singapura-meaning 'lion city' or 'kota singa'.
